description: Removal of existing single storey projection to rear (demolition), erection of two single storey side extensions, installation of dormer window and rooflights to side elevation, replacement of existing dormer window with new materials, replacement and repair of windows on all elevations, new double glazed window to rear elevation, repair of front boundary pillars, alterations to fencing and insertion of gates, internal changes to ground, first and second floors, conversion of laundry room into bathroom and creation of utility room on the second floor, demolition of garden shed
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):

Location plan, 2115_A002 B - Proposed ground floor plan, 2115_A003 A - Proposed first floor plan, 2115_A004 A - Proposed second floor plan, 2115_A005 A - Roof plan as proposed, 2115_A006 A - Site plan as proposed, 2115_A007 A - East (Front) elevation as proposed, 2115_A008 A - Proposed West (rear) elevation, 2115_A009 A - Proposed North (side) elevation, 2115_A010 C - Proposed South (side) elevation, 2115_A011 A - Section CC as proposed, 2115_D001 - Existing and proposed fence and gate, 2115_D002 - Typical sash window details, 2115_D003 - Typical casement window details, 2115_E002 - Existing ground floor plan, 2115_E003 - Existing first floor plan, 2115_E004 - Existing second floor plan, 2115_E005 - Existing roof plan, 2115_E006 - Existing site plan, 2115_E007 - Existing front elevation, 2115_E008 - Existing rear elevation, 2115_E009 - Existing side elevation, 2115_E010 - Existing side elevation, 2115_E011 - Existing section, Email from Neil Kahawatte dated 17/11/2022, Emails from William Neil dated 16/11/2022
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all new work and work of making good shall match the existing original work, and in the case of brickwork, in respect of materials, colour, texture, facebond and pointing, and in the case of window joinery, in respect of materials used, form, dimensions, profiles and surface finish.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to the construction of the side extensions, details of the proposed materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall then be carried out as per approved.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| All existing features both internally and externally shall be retained in situ and protected during the course of the works including joinery, plasterwork and chimneypieces unless specifically authorised otherwise on the drawings hereby approved and as stated in condition 2.

Reason:  To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).
| Details of any new plasterwork and any ornamental features shall be submitted to and approved by the Council prior to the commencement of work.

Reason:  To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).
| Details of the new external and internal doors shall be submitted to and approved by the Council prior to the commencement of this part of the work.

Reason:  To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).

| Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason:  To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).
| The permitted rooflights shall at all times be of a conservation style. These shall also at all times be flush with the roofslope.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The proposed gates to the driveway shall at all times, open inwards towards the site.
Reason: To ensure that the proposed development would not cause harm to the adjacent footpath and the pedestrians, in accordance with Policy T4 of the London Plan 2021.

| Prior to the commencement of the works to the deflected front gable window, details of the investigative and remedial repair works to the deflected front gable window should be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Once agreed, these works shall then be carried out.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed changes would harmonise with the listed building as well as the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
